entries.meaning: The string of an archer's bow.
(historical) The string of an archer's bow, as used by the Turks for strangling offenders.

verbs.description: bowstring (third-person singular simple present bowstrings, present participle bowstringing, simple past and past participle bowstrung or bowstringed)

examples: When the day broke  […]  it was high time for her to get up and be bowstrung—a thing very little more pleasant than hanging, only a trifle more genteel.
